IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE CONNECTICUT PLAYERS FOUNDATION, INC. D/B/A LONG WHARF THEATRE (THE ORGANIZATION") IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION LOCATED IN NEW HAVEN, CONNECTICUT. FOUNDED IN 1965, LONG WHARF THEATRE'S MISSION STATES THAT IT "IS DEDICATED TO PRODUCING BOUNDARY-BREAKING THEATRE WITH AND FOR ITS MANY, KALEIDOSCOPIC COMMUNITIES." OVER ITS 58 YEARS, LONG WHARF THEATRE HAS GROWN TO BECOME A CELEBRATED THEATRE COMPANY WITH AN INTERNATIONAL REPUTATION FOR EXCELLENCE. THEY INCUBATED SOME OF THE MOST IMPORTANT PLAYS THAT ARE NOW PART OF THE AMERICAN THEATRE CANON, INCLUDING THREE WINNERS OF THE PULITZER PRIZE FOR DRAMA. LONG WHARF THEATRE HAS BUILT A POWERFUL BODY OF MORE THAN 400 PRODUCTIONS THAT REPRESENT THE BEST OF NEW WORK, CLASSIC PLAYS, AND CONTEMPORARY MUSICALS. HONORED WITH THE TONY AWARD FOR OUTSTANDING REGIONAL THEATRE, LONG WHARF THEATRE PRODUCES AN ANNUAL SEASON OF PLAYS, ALONG WITH INVESTMENTS IN NEW WORK, COMMUNITY PROGRAMS, AND SPECIAL EVENTS BY, FOR, AND WITH ITS GREATER NEW HAVEN COMMUN
IRS990.MissionDesc: LONG WHARF THEATRE IS DEDICATED TO PRODUCING BOUNDARY-BREAKING THEATRE WITH AND FOR ITS MANY, KALEIDOSCOPIC COMMUNITIES. OUR VISION IS THEATRE FOR EVERYONE.
IRS990.Desc: FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023, THE THEATRE PRODUCED 27 PERFORMANCES OF FOUR PLAYS AND PRESENTED AN ADDITIONAL OFFERING, FOR A TOTAL AUDIENCE OF 1,975, INCLUDING 12 FULLY SUBSIDIZED TICKETS FOR K-12 STUDENTS AND 41 HEAVILY SUBSIDIZED TICKETS FOR COLLEGE STUDENTS. THE THEATRE INTENTIONALLY RELAXED ITS PRODUCING EFFORTS DURING THIS FISCAL YEAR TO ALLOW FOR A MOVE OUT OF A FACILITY IT HAD LEASED FOR 57 YEARS. THREE FALL EVENTS WERE STAGED READINGS HAD THREE PERFORMANCES OVER A WEEKEND, RATHER THAN OVER MULTIPLE WEEKS, AND ONE FULLY PRODUCED PRODUCTION OFFERED IN SPRING 2023 WITH FEWER PERFORMANCES THAN USUAL. THE THEATRE'S COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM INCLUDED PRODUCING A SHORT EDUCATIONAL FILM EXPLORING THE MUSLIM-AMERICAN EXPERIENCE. THE FILM WAS PRESENTED AT 5 DIFFERENT LOCATIONS FOR A TOTAL OF 274 AUDIENCES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION PAID 4,000 TO A COMPANY FOR REPRESENTATION BEFORE THE EXECUTIVE AND LEGISLATIVE BRANCHES OF THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT AND FOR GOVERNMENT CONSULTING SERVICES.
TO BE USED FOR GENERAL OPERATIONS AND VARIOUS PROGRAM INITIATIVES.
THE ORGANIZATION BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
MANAGING DIRECTOR AND ARTISTIC DIRECTOR EACH HAVE A DISCRETIONARY SPENDING ACCOUNT WHICH ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT LEAST ANNUALLY.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: SPOUSE OF MANAGING DIRECTOR CHRISTINE INGUI

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT OF FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUESTS THAT ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES SIGN AN ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY CERTIFICATION. IN ADDITION, BOARD MEMBERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUESTED TO COMPLETE AN ANNUAL FORM 990 DISCLOSURE WHICH REQUESTS DISCLOSURE OF ANY INTEREST THE COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION OF ALL KEY EMPLOYEES IS DISCUSSEED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD. COMPENSATION IS GENERALLY BASED ON INDUSTRY STANDARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE ON GUIDESTAR.ORG. FULL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AND ARE POSTED ON THE NEW YORK STATE CHARITIES BUREAU WEBSITE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD HAS APPROVED THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE ANNUAL AUDIT.
